title: 103_hr3050
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is being amended to include approximately 195,610 acres as depicted on a map. Additionally, amendments include setting a deadline for the management plan and granting exchange authority. The Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is amended to allow the Secretary to transfer approximately 20 acres of Federal lands to the owner of the Old Nevada recreation facility in exchange for lands of equal or greater value within the conservation area. Priority dates related to rights associated with lands added to the Act are also amended. The Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is amended to change priority dates for rights associated with lands added to the conservation area. The Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is amended to change priority dates for rights associated with lands added to the conservation area. SEC. 3. POTENTIAL CONSERVATION LANDS. The lands identified in subsection (b) are withdrawn from public land laws, including mining laws, and may be added to the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area in 5 years unless necessary licenses are obtained for a hydroelectric project. The lands identified in subsection (b) are withdrawn from public land laws and may be added to the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area in 5 years if necessary licenses for a hydroelectric project are obtained. Licenses and rights-of-way must be issued before the effective date. The date of adding the lands to the conservation area will be considered the date of enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. AUSTIN, NEVADA MUSEUM. The Austin Historic Mining District Historical Society is allowed to use approximately 0.59 acres of land in Austin, Nevada for a museum or historical facility for 20 years. The Historical Society can use the designated lands for 20 years, paying an annual rental of $100. If allowed to continue after 20 years, they must pay a reasonable rental determined by the Secretary of Agriculture. The Society is responsible for maintenance, repairs, and payments for structures on the land. The Secretary of Agriculture receives rentals for designated lands and deposits them according to the Act of December 4, 1967. The curr_chunk is about the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States who also serves as the President of the Senate.
